docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A SHARP increase in sales of the stimulant Ritalin has rekindled an emotional debate over whether the substance is being prescribed to help youngsters with a specific hyperactive disorder, or instead to sedate unruly pupils whom teachers cannot control.

headline.main: SALES OF DRUG ARE SOARING FOR TREATMENT OF HYPERACTIVITY

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: BARRY GERSTEN wants to light up a lot of cigarettes outside his new pharmacy in Stamford, but not in the conventional manner.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: I DROVE ALL THE WAY IN THE RIGHT-HAND lane this morning,'' says one of the senior executives proudly. His five colleagues sitting around a conference-room tabel nod approval. They are part of the fast track, at the San Francisco headquarters of the Pacific Gas and Electric Company, but they are also determined to sample life in the slow lane.

headline.main: A NEW TAKE ON TYPE A

byline.original: By Marilyn M. Machlowitz: Marilyn M. Machlowitz, the author of 'Workaholics,' is the president of the Machlowitz Company, a New York consulting firm that conducts management studies and executive seminars

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Federal officials have proposed an expanded definition of AIDS in a move that will increase the recorded number of cases by 20 percent and make important social benefits available to thousands of additional patients.

headline.main: WIDER AIDS DEFINITION PROPOSED IN MOVE TO EXPAND U.S. BENEFITS

docs.snippet: LEAD: Federal officials have proposed an expanded definition of AIDS in a move that will increase the recorded number of cases by 20 percent and make important social benefits available to thousands of additional patients.
